response.overview: The film is a portrait of a generation of women who crawled out of the shadow of the punk movement in the late seventies, because they also wanted to play like men and at the same time wanted to be seen and heard. Women who did not want to submit to a male-dominated music industry and who used the 80s generation's liberation of the individual and sexuality to rebel against authority and societal norms. Women – Lise Cabble, Mette Soele Zachau Mathiesen, Lene Lykke Davidsen, Minna Grooss and the late Anne Vig Skoven – who, together with a number of other women in the years from 1975 to 1997, were first the punk/indie female band Clinic Q, which became pop/rock the band Miss B. Haven, which was successful far beyond Denmark's borders.
response.title: Endeløs Nat
